sentence.Network_en: Ironically, the latest clamp-down has just led to renewed international criticism.
sentence.Network_cn: 让人哭笑不得的是，最近的制裁结果只是导致新一波国际社会的批评。

sentence.Network_en: Classmates at West Point had ironically dubbed him Beauty.
sentence.Network_cn: 西点军校的同学们曾挖苦地戏称他为“美人”。

sentence.Network_en: Ironically, for a man who hated war, he would have made a superb war cameraman.
sentence.Network_cn: 具有讽刺意味的是，他这个痛恨战争的人曾有可能成为一个优秀的战地摄影师。

entry.tran: 具有讽刺意味的是;令人哭笑不得的是
entry.def: You use ironically to draw attention to a situation which is odd or amusing because it involves a contrast.

example.ex: Ironically, for a man who hated war, he would have made a superb war cameraman.
example.tran: 具有讽刺意味的是,他这个痛恨战争的人曾有可能成为一个优秀的战地摄影师。

entry.def: If you say something ironically, you do not mean it and are saying it as a joke.

example.ex: Classmates at West Point had ironically dubbed him Beauty.
example.tran: 西点军校的同学们曾挖苦地戏称他为“美人”。

sentences.sentence: "ironically, he ended up losing money under his own plan"

auth_sentence.content: Ironically, the best song is the most throwaway.

auth_sentence.content: Ironically it was created by the Republican Richard Nixon.

jushi.english: Ironically,his cold got better on the last day of his holiday.
jushi.chinese: 具有讽刺意味的是，在假期的最后一天,他的感冒才见好。
